summary: The Farmers Feeding America Act (HR 4314) aims to amend the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (SNAP) to require that SNAP benefits be used to purchase food products grown, produced, and manufactured in the United States (American food products). The bill defines 'American food product', and outlines retailer obligations to prioritize these products. The Secretary of Agriculture will maintain a list of exempted foods and implement regulations for enforcement, including a public awareness campaign and an annual review of the Act's impact. The effective date is set for one year after enactment.
